results.title: Bebert et L'omnibus = Bebert and the Bus
results.brief_description:
Bebert is a five-year-old boy who becomes separated from his older brother on a train. The precocious moppet observes the less-than-grown-up activities of the adults as he seeks to be reunited with his family.

Credits: Producer, Leon Carre ; director, Yves Robert ; writer, Francois Boyer ; photography, Andre Bac ; Music, Philippe Gerard ; musical direction, Francois Rauber ; editor, Andre and Monique Isnardon.
Cast: Petit Gibus, Blanchette Brunoy, Pierre Mondy, Jean Richard, Michel Serrault, Jacques Higelin, Jean Lefebvre, Tsilla Chelton, Sophie Grimaldi.

results.title: Beavis and Butt-head
results.creator_credit: Film Roman Productions, MTV Animation, J.J. Sedelmaier Productions, Paramount Television, Judgemental Films Inc., Tenth Annual Industries, Ternion Pictures and Mike Judge
results.brief_description: Beavis and Butt-head are high school students whose lifestyles revolve around TV, junk food (usually nachos), shopping malls, heavy metal music, and trying to “score with chicks”. Each show contains short cartoons centering on the duo who live in the fictitious town of Highland, Texas. The episodes are broken up by short breaks in which Beavis and Butt-head watch and make fun of music videos.

constellations_other.name: Horror movie right there on my TV
constellations_other.description: The colourful and quirky music video for Skyhooksâ€™ song 'Horror Movie' helped propel them to number one, making it their biggest hit.

results.title: Beaver dam
results.creator_credit: F.R. Crawley, Crawley Films and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A film for children, one of its greatest appeal is watching the beaver at work, busily and cheerfully demonstrating the characteristics for which it is famous. Sometimes, however, a beaver’s industry runs counter to the plans of people. When the beaver’s dam floods their father’s hay field, two boys quickly devise a plan to save the beaver from their father’s displeasure.

results.title: Beauty knows no pain
results.creator_credit: Elliott Erwitt and Elliott Erwitt Enterprises
results.brief_description: Illustrates behind the scenes story of how Kilgore College in Texas creates the nationally known drill team, The Rangerettes, which smiles its way through the half-time interval at college football games. Useful as a study of group dynamics, mass hysteria and the 1960s - 70s stereotyped view of the female image. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Beauty and the beast: the enchanted christmas
results.creator_credit: Andy Knight and Walt Disney Television Animation
results.brief_description: Belle vows to bring a little of the Christmas spirit into the Beast’s castle, even though he has lots of misgivings about the success of her plans. All the enchanted objects chip in, even the reluctant Angelique, a beautiful tree ornament. The evil Forte, a pipe organ wants to undo all of Belle’s plans and so spoil Christmas for everyone, but as in all good fairy tales, it all ends up happily ever after with the Christmas spirit intact.

results.title: Beauty and the Beast = La Belle et la Bete
results.brief_description: Cocteau’s retelling of the classic “Beauty and the Beast” is addressed to “what remains of the child in all of us”, but by avoiding all whimsy and sentimentality its appeal is universal. The Beast becomes another poetic figure in Cocteau’s personal mythology, while his enchanted castle is evoked by some of the most startling imagery in cinema history - worthy of comparison with Murnau’s haunting “Nosferatu”. Cocteau’s fairytale set standards in fantasy which few other filmmakers have reached. The sequences in the enchanted castle are pure magic. Cast includes Josette Day and Jean Marais.

results.title: Beauty and the beast (Disney)
results.creator_credit: Kirk Wise, Gary Trousdale, Don Hahn, Silver Screen Partners IV and Walt Disney Pictures
results.brief_description: This animated “tale as old as time” follows the adventures of Belle, a bright young woman imprisoned in the castle of a mysterious beast. With the assistance of the castle’s enchanted staff, a tender romance develops between these two unlikely friends and Belle learns the most important lesson of all, that true beauty comes from within. Voices include Angela Lansbsury, Robby Benson and David Ogden Stiers. (Awards: Oscar winning music: Best Song and Best Score).

results.title: Beautiful thing
results.creator_credit: Hettie Macdonald, Bill Shapter, Tony Garnett and Channel Four Television
results.brief_description: Teenager Jamie Gangel (Glenn Berry) shares a council flat in South London with his extroverted but warm hearted bar tender mother, Sandra (Linda Henry). Jamie is a quiet and introverted student, victimised by his school mates for being a homosexual, and frustrated by his mother in yet another relationship. On either side of them live Jamie’s abused school mate Ste (Scott Neal), and the delinquent, Mother Cass afficionado, Leah (Tameka Empson). When Ste runs to the Gangel’s after another bout of abuse he finds himself sharing a room with Jamie, and soon begins to question his sexual identity when Jamie reveals that he is queer. In the small confines of the council flats the close knit neighbourhood find out as much about themselves as the new relationship that’s going on separated by the thin fibro walls.
